audiobook.description:
Author(s): Henry Marsh Narrator(s): Jim Barclay

With compassion and candor, leading neurosurgeon Henry Marsh reveals the fierce joy of operating, the profoundly moving triumphs, the harrowing disasters, the haunting regrets, and the moments of black humor that characterize a brain surgeon's life. If you believe that brain surgery is a precise and exquisite craft, practiced by calm and detached surgeons, this gripping, brutally honest account will make you think again.

Longlisted for both the Guardian First Book Award and the Samuel Johnson Prize for Non-Fiction, Do No Harm ranks alongside the work of Atul Gawande, Jerome Groopman, and Oliver Sacks.
audiobook.html_description:
Author(s): Henry Marsh
Narrator(s): Jim Barclay
<p>With compassion and candor, leading neurosurgeon Henry Marsh reveals the fierce joy of operating, the profoundly moving triumphs, the harrowing disasters, the haunting regrets, and the moments of black humor that characterize a brain surgeon's life. If you believe that brain surgery is a precise and exquisite craft, practiced by calm and detached surgeons, this gripping, brutally honest account will make you think again.</p><p>Longlisted for both the Guardian First Book Award and the Samuel Johnson Prize for Non-Fiction, <i>Do No Harm</i> ranks alongside the work of Atul Gawande, Jerome Groopman, and Oliver Sacks.</p>
audiobook.name: Do No Harm: Stories of Life, Death, and Brain Surgery
